Class GameStateManager

java.lang.Object
parade.gameStates.GameStateManager
public class GameStateManager extends Object
Manages the flow and transitions between different game states. Responsible for initializing the game, moving between phases (init, turns, final round, end), and providing access to shared resources like the input manager and game context.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    Description
    GameStateManager(InputManager inputManager, Game game)
    Constructs a new GameStateManager and initializes the game state flow.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameStateManager

      public GameStateManager(InputManager inputManager, Game game)
      Constructs a new GameStateManager and initializes the game state flow.
      Parameters:
      inputManager - the input manager to use for all states
      game - the Game instance controlling this session

  • Method Details

    • init

      public void init()
      Initializes the game by setting the initial state and generating the game context.

    • setState

      public void setState(GameState newState)
      Transitions the game to the specified new state and executes it.
      Parameters:
      newState - the new GameState to transition to

    • getInputManager

      public InputManager getInputManager()
      Retrieves the input manager used for player input during the game.
      Returns:
      the current InputManager

    • nextState

      public void nextState()
      Proceeds to the next logical game state based on the current state. Uses the state flow map to determine the next transition.

    • getGameStateID

      public String getGameStateID()
      Returns the unique identifier of the game state session.
      Returns:
      the game state ID

    • exitGame

      public void exitGame()
      Exits the game by calling the Game's exit method.
